title: Emerging Technologies Changing the Facilities Management Landscape - CleanLink
summary: The article discusses how emerging technologies are changing the cleaning and facilities management industry.  Autonomous cleaning equipment, UV technology, touchless fixtures, and IoT integration are being used to improve efficiency and reduce costs.  Facility managers are increasingly looking to these technologies to address labor shortages and improve sanitation in a post-COVID world.

title: Building Sustainability's Digital Future with EcoStruxure™ Resource Advisor Copilot: Schneider Electric's Latest AI ... - PR Newswire
summary: Schneider Electric has announced its plans to launch EcoStruxure Resource Advisor Copilot, a conversational AI tool designed to help businesses manage their energy and sustainability data. This new tool uses Large Language Model technology to provide users with enhanced data analysis, visualization, and decision support, enabling them to make faster and more informed decisions regarding their resource management strategies.

title: Why Customers Leave Platforms — and How to Retain Them - HBR.org Daily
summary: Platform businesses, like those facilitating transactions between buyers and sellers, face a constant threat of being disintermediated. This means their users bypass the platform and engage directly, as seen in examples like readers buying online instead of from bookstores or programmers contracting directly with clients. Disintermediation can be fatal to platform businesses, as it has been for companies like Borders books, Blockbuster, and Tower records.

title: Benefits of Using Digital Twins Across Industries - AiThority
summary: Digital twins are virtual replicas of physical objects, processes, or systems that can be used to optimize operations, simulate scenarios, and make data-driven decisions. These digital twins are being used across various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, transportation, and energy, to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and promote sustainability.  Examples of companies using digital twins include GE, Siemens, Microsoft, and ABB, among others.

title: RapDev Named Datadog Partner of the Year; Announces Launch of 4 New Products on Datadog Marketplace - PR Newswire
summary: RapDev, a leading DevOps engineering firm, has been awarded the 2023 Datadog Partner Network (DPN) North America Partner of the Year Award. The company has launched four new offerings on the Datadog marketplace, including SwiftMQ, Spacelift, IBM Cloud, and Datadog Usage Tracker integrations. These integrations aim to improve operational efficiency, reduce downtime, and enhance cost management for Datadog customers.
